alert.note: Alert for Eastern Greenbrier; Monroe; Western Greenbrier (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 15 at 12:51AM EST until December 15 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations from a glaze up to two tenths of an inch possible. Locally higher amounts north of I-64 and along the Blue Ridge north of Roanoke. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Virginia and southeast West Virginia. * WHEN...until 1 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. Bridges and overpasses may be icy even if the main roads are not. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Power outages and tree damage are possible due to the ice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Freezing rain will become more widespread this morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
